channel.title: China on Alien Truth Social

item.title: UFO sightings in China
item.description:
UFO Sightings in China ðŸ”—

This article documents alleged sightings of unidentified flying objects (UFOs) in China.

1994 ðŸ”—

This section focuses on “The Meng Zhaoguo Incident,” a purported close encounter of the third kind that Meng Zhaoguo claimed to have experienced in Phoenix Mountain, Wuchang, Heilongjiang. In 1994, Meng reported seeing a white, shining object descend into the mountain. He claimed to have been harassed by entities, taken aboard their spacecraft, and forced to copulate. He also stated that he was shown images of Jupiter, which the entities claimed was their homeworld. The UFO Enthusiasts Club at Wuhan University examined his story and concluded that while the initial contact might have occurred, the subsequent events were likely untrue. Other UFO groups in China, however, believed his claims.

2010 ðŸ”—

This section details a UFO sighting that occurred on July 7 above Hangzhou Xiaoshan International Airport near Hangzhou. The airport was temporarily closed due to the sighting. An investigation found no radar images and determined that the purported images of the UFO were not taken near the airport. The investigation concluded that the object may have been an aircraft, possibly military.

See also ðŸ”—

This section provides a link to the “List of reported UFO sightings” for broader context.

References ðŸ”—

This section lists the sources cited in the article, including news articles and websites.

source: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/UFO_sightings_in_China
